game
Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
  game.GameWorld

public class GameWorld
extends java.lang.Object

GameWorld contains all the elements necessary to run a single game of Robot Wars. The game world tracks the position of the robots on the game grid, verifies the validity of actions issued (two robots can not occupy the same spot), tracks points per player, keeps track of the current turn, and otherwise maintains all the states necessary for a robust gaming environment.

Author:
Michael Pinnegar

Method Detail

addRobot

void addRobot(Robot robot,
              DecisionEngine script)
Adds a robot to the game world in one of the four corners, and initializes the decision engine inside of the game world

Parameters:
robot - Robot to be added
script - VMC compiled script to run the robot

moveRobot

boolean moveRobot(int playerNumber,
                  CardinalDirections moveTo)
Moves the given player's robot one spot in the given direction. Returns true if the robot was moved, false if the robot was not moved. Will not move the robot if it is trying to move into another robot or a wall.

Parameters:
playerNumber - Player who's robot is to be moved
moveTo - Direction robot is to be moved
Returns:
Whether or not the robot was successfully moved

processGameFunction

int processGameFunction(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parameters,
                        java.lang.String gameFunctionCallID)
Takes in a game function, it's parameters, and returns an integer representing the state of the game world.

Parameters:
parameters - Parameter list for the game world
gameFunctionCallID - Name of the game function to be called
Returns:
Value representing the current

whatPlayerIsIn

int whatPlayerIsIn(GameWorld.Coordinate location)
Tells which player is at a given location. Returns -1 if there is no player there.

Parameters:
location - Location to be checked for a player
Returns:
0-3 if there is a player, -1 if there is not

calcNewCoordinatesOneSpotAway

private GameWorld.Coordinate calcNewCoordinatesOneSpotAway(GameWorld.Coordinate currentPos,
                                                           CardinalDirections moveTo)
Helper function that calculates the x-y position of a spot in a given direction

Parameters:
currentPos - Base position that the new one will be calculated from
moveTo - Direction that the new position will be in relative to the base position
Returns:
Coordinates with XY representing the new spot. Null if that spot is illegal.
